status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Looks like this was due to an improper use of the Gram default constructor that happened as a part of the 0.20.2 refactoring work. Does it make any sense to mark things like this, which should only be used by the serialization mechanism inside hadoop, as @deprecated, so that people don't use them in regular code?
Well deprecated has a different meaning doesnt it. Lets wait for the visibility annotations like that used in Hadoop code nowadays. Dont bother too much at the moment.
